segments.text: I notice the woman is so focused on drying that plate, like nothing else exists.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just gushing out, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy on that stool, and it makes me nervous just looking at him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so patient, just waiting for her cookie like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman must be exhausted or something to miss all this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window is so bright, but it’s like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll slip on that puddle before she even notices it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookies look delicious, but the way they’re getting them is just asking for trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for her, cleaning up while the kids are making a mess behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should really step in before something bad happens.
segments.speaker: PAR
